## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
#CARGANDO LA DATA A TRABAJAR 
data <-read.csv("C:/Users/Marco/Downloads/conoc_actit_factor_cancer_cervical.csv")
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#LIMPIAR LA DATA DE UNA COLUMNA ESPECIFICA, QUE CONTENGA DATOS 
data_limpia <-data[!is.na(data$Edad), ]
```

```{r}
#INSTALAR PAQUETES

install.packages("ggplot2")
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r}
#histograma
hist(data$edad,
     main = "Histograma de Edad",
     xlab = "Edad",
     col = "lightblue",
     border = "black")
hist(data$conoc_actit_factor_cancer_cervical.csv"
     main = "histograma de conoc_actit_factor_cancer_cervical.csv"
     xlab = "conoc_actit_factor_cancer_cervical.csv",
     col  = "lightgreer""
     borders("black")
     
```

```{r}
#MEDIDAS DE TENDENCIA CENTRAL
#MEDIA ARITMETICA
mean(data$)
    #MODA
mode_Sexo<-names(sort(table(data$Sexo),decreasing = TRUE))
mode_Edad<-names(sort(table(data$Edad),decreasing = TRUE))
     
```

```{r}
#MEDIANA
median(data$Edad)
     
```

```{r}
#MEDIDAS DE DISPERSION
var(data$Edad,na.rm = TRUE)
```

```{r}
 #DESVIACION ESTANDAR
sd(data$Edad,na.rm = TRUE)

```

```{r}
#RANGO 
range(data$Edad,na.rm = TRUE)
     
```

```{r}
#RANGO INTERCUARTILICO
IQR(data$Edad,na.rm = TRUE)
     
```

```{r}
 #MEDIDAS DE POSICION
     
     
#CUARTIL
quantile(data$Edad,probs = c(0.25,0.5,0.75,0.90),na.rm = TRUE)
summary(data$Edad)
```

```{r}
#CON TODAS LAS VARIABLES
summary(data)
     
```

```{r}
 #TABLAS DE FRECUENCIA PARA VARIABLES CATEGORICAS
     table(data$Sexo)
     prop.table(table(data$Sexo))
     table(data$Dias_Seguimiento)
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
